Author: sobradonocentro
Text: i don't know what's your case and i hope this don't sound too moralizing, but we feel the urge to bing mostly because of restricting. if we limit our bodies to certain foods and do not give it what they want, it will certainly end up in binging episodes. maybe we should be more worried in working ourselves to stop restricting :( getting higher and higher... it's hard. stay safe.

Author: Raynx
Text: I also suffer from binging problems. Although there's no magic cure, what I found to help so far :  * Eating a lot of fat and protein while cutting sugar; this might seem counter-intuitive, being more calorie-dense, but you will feel full for longer.  * Find an occupation that will use a lot of your time when you have nothing to do. I personally binge out of boredom, food is replacing an emotional void I need to fill with something else.   * Think about tomorrow. Think about the fact that, no matter what you do *today*, you will always have access to food whenever you want, at any point in your life; so you don't need to gorge yourself *right now.* You can have fun once in a while, as long as it doesn't happen every day.
